title: Is Windows 10 good for video editing? - Quora

response.answer_text: I recently made the switch to a Windows 10 machine after editing on Macs for almost 30 years. I had recently made the jump from Adobe Premiere to Black Magic’s DaVinci Resolve, and my five year old iMac just wasn’t up to the task of doing more complicated editing. In December I built a fast PC for about $950. Resolve is flying now. I will have to say it has taken a minute to get used to the Windows interface, but I’m very comfortable with it now. I still do some work on my Mac systems, but the Windows machine is my main system.

The operating system (Windows 10) is mostly irrelevant. The hardware and application(s) that you use matter much more than the OS, so long as the operating system’s drivers for the hardware are robust. The only thing about Windows 10 that’s off-putting to most people is using it outside the video editing software. It’s got a lot of inconsistent UI elements and organization, but people adjust to the awkwardness of it pretty quickly.
